required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Electrical Stimulation for Facial Muscles
clinical_study.official_title: Applying Functional Electrical Stimulation to Facial Muscles After Acute Paralysis

brief_summary.textblock: Partial or complete facial paralysis is the weakness of muscles of facial expression. Facial paralysis causes physical, social and emotional problems. Functional electrical stimulation (FES) for facial paralysis is a technique in which muscles are electrically stimulated, causing them to contract This study is designed to help patients with facial nerve weakness.

primary_outcome.description: Change in ability to close eyelids, measured in mm

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Elevation of Corner of Mouth Over 14 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Change in ability to raise corner of mouth, measured in mm

primary_outcome.measure: Change House-Brackmann Scale Measurement Over 14 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The House-Brackmann facial nerve grading scale is a measure of facial nerve impairment. The scale ranges from values 1 to 6, with larger values indicating greater facial nerve impairment.
Patient-based instrument to measure both facial impairment and disability. This will be used to identify patient's perceived change in facial impairment for the duration of the study period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Facial Movements Over 14 weeks
primary_outcome.description: A video will be taken of the patient undergoing standard facial movements
A structured interview questionnaire administered by a study team member to identify any changes to the therapy that may be needed before further studies are conducted

arm_group.arm_group_label: Acute Facial Nerve Injury with Intact Facial Nerve
arm_group.description: 40 sessions of FES (in a 14 week period) Assessments will be taken during the beginning, middle, and end of each study arm.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Facial Nerve Grafting After Surgical Excision
arm_group.description: 40 sessions of FES (in a 14 week period) Assessments will be taken during the beginning, middle, and end of each study arm.
No FES Assessments will be taken at the same intervals as the interventions group.

intervention.intervention_name: Application of FES to the Face
intervention.description: Functional electrical stimulation (FES) for facial paralysis is a technique in which muscles are electrically stimulated.
intervention.arm_group_label: Acute Facial Nerve Injury with Intact Facial Nerve
Facial Nerve Grafting After Surgical Excision

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients experiencing unilateral facial nerve paralysis Brackmann 5/6 or 6/6.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of epilepsy or seizures.
- Individuals with metal orthopedic implants in the mouth (e.g. plates or screws).
- Individuals suffering from fibromyalgia.
- Individuals currently receiving any form of transcranial brain stimulation (e.g. rTMS, ECT, or MST).
